Title: AUTUMN QUARTER 2023
reflection:
It's my last first day of school! Maybe ever?
Coming into the school year was more than a little hectic because I only had a few days of break. After my internship ended, I was immediately working on events for iWelcome week, for WINFO's First Year Rep applications, and just getting into the swing of things. I don't know how to describe it, but the vibe just feels... different. I feel older but also more free. My biggest goal for the next two quarters is to go out more and have fun - I want to enjoy the little time I have left on Campus.
In terms of class, I am actually not taking a single INFO class. Since I technically finished all of the degree requirements after I finished Capstone in the Spring, I am focusing this quarter more on my ESRM minor. To that end, I am taking four classes, three of which are ESRM related, and the fourth one is an Honors class about Data Science and WEB DuBois.
Taking three esrm classes at the same time proved to be a really big challenge for me. Almost all of the material I was learning was brand new, and since I was taking upper divs, I often felt really behind when talking about concepts that were covered in the more general classes. Additionally, since I am not in the major, getting into the right class at the right time proved difficult. Despite all of the challenges I faced in these classes, I grew to enjoy them, and I learned a lot. One of my favorite experiences was going on a field trip to the Yakama Valley. One of the professors of the class, Polly, is a member of the tribe, and showed us around her tribe's home.
Throughout this course, my perspective on ecology, natural resource management, social sciences, and culture has undergone a significant change. Coming into this class, I really felt out of my depth when doing my readings. However, learnign about Traditional Indigenous Knowledge and its intersections with western science and environmental management has broadened my understanding of how different ways of knowing contribute to holistic and sustainable approaches. With most problems, including climate change, there is no one ‚Äúright‚Äù way to face them. I learned that here, Empathy applies too. Taking the time to listen to and uplift marginalized voices can help us build stronger communities and tackle lager problems.

gallery.gallery_alt: Roshni in front of the Big 4 Ice Caves
gallery.gallery_reflection: This quarter, I took a class called National Parks and Recreation, and one of the fun things we did was take a trip to the Big 4 Ice Caves! It was freezing most of the time, but I learned a lot about wildlife management. Even though there are multiple signs posted about the danger of going into the caves, people still go into the caves anyway because they are naturally curious. One of my favorite parts of this trip was when we toured the ranger station and I got to be airlifted into a helicopter!

gallery.gallery_alt: A tent I built by myself
gallery.gallery_reflection: I took a field trip to the Yakama Valley to learn about the culture and history of the Yakama nation, as well as to experience the culture of the tribe. This was such a great experience for me, and I found so many similarities and differences between the cultures that I am part of, and the culture that was shared with me through this field trip. I left with a profound insight on how we are all tied to nature, and how cycles of life need to be protected so that all of us can thrive. One thing that I was especially proud of was pitching my own tent!

gallery.gallery_alt: Me and Tarini wearing a sari that our cousin bought for us
gallery.gallery_reflection: Over winter break, My family and I went to India for my Uncle's 60th birthday! It was a short trip - we only went for three weeks, but the weather was a welcome change. We spent a lot of time exploring different places in Chennai with our cousin, and while the trip was hectic, it was still a lot of fun. This picture is from when Tarini and I were wearing saris and distributed kalkandu

gallery.gallery_alt: A picture of me on the wall of Mary Gates Hall
gallery.gallery_reflection: Last year, I won the Husky 100, and to my surprise, I walked into the 4th floor of Mary Gates and I saw my face on the wall (lmaoo). While I wish I had picked a better picture of me, it was still a nice surprise.

gallery.gallery_alt: I attended the night carnival and took a photo at the booth
gallery.gallery_reflection: Before the school year started, I stopped by the UW Night Carnival after work to have fun and see the booths! I really wanted to get a wax hand, and I did! It didn't last very long, but it was still a fun experience

gallery.gallery_alt: polaroid photos of me and sai
gallery.gallery_reflection: This year, I also got a polaroid camera and I want to use it to take photos of my favorite memories, so that they can last a lifetime :))

gallery.gallery_alt: My friends and I on our way to Garba
gallery.gallery_reflection: This is most of our roommate team (plus Vidhi, minus Sai) We all got dressed up and went to Garba, which was a lot of fun. I love the lehenga I am wearing because it is so light and it is such a beautiful design. Garba was also really fun, but I liked it better than last year. I think this will be one of the last South Asian RSO events I will go to - maily because I have more fun hanging out with my friends instead of the actual event.

gallery.gallery_alt: Nila and I in the sun in Gowen Hall
gallery.gallery_reflection: This was also my first quarter being the lead TA for INFO 200. One of the most significant aspects of being the Lead TA has been the opportunity to serve as a mentor for my peers. Starting in Fall, we had a lot of new TAs join our teaching team, and it was often my job to show them how labs worked, and what to do during lab. I am really glad to have Nila be a TA alongside me, and I felt like our friendship has grown so much. Here we are sitting in the sun in Gowen.
There is not enough space in the world for me to talk about WINFO. I am so happy we got to have more bondings, and I am so incredibly proud of this team. I have no words ü•∫

gallery.gallery_alt: an instagram flyer for iSquad bonding
gallery.gallery_reflection: This was one of the highest attended events that I have ever been to! We organized a meetup at Boba Gem on the Ave, and then led everyone to the quad to play games. I met a lot of super amazing people, and some of them even joined WINFO later!

Title: WINTER QUARTER 2024
reflection:
Guys...... It's my last quarter!!! I seriously cannot believe I'm saying this, and will finally be done with my undergraduate degree.
This quarter, I've taken a lot less credits - I'm taking INFO 441 to learn server-side development, ESS 100 as a fun class to learn about different types of dinosaurs, and Honors 496, where I made this website and fleshed it out in it's entirety. Since my only required class this quarter is for Honors, I chose the other two just for fun! I have really enjoyed taking 441 this quarter - I think it is one of the most useful classes I have ever taken at the UW, and I really like the way Kyle teaches the class. I am especially proud of my assignments, where I have worked on building a website sharer and also a productivity app. I think this class will help me a lot as I try to switch into front-end or full-stack development in the future. My dinosaurs class on the other hand, has been less useful in terms of my career but still so fun to take. I never knew that there were so many different types of dinosaurs (my favorites are Sinosauropteryx and Spinosaurus) and that modern-day birds are in the same clade as dinosaurs. I also have amassed a large collection of plastic dinosaurs that I got from asking questions in class.
While this is my last quarter, there have been a lot of firsts. My goal is to be more outgoing, do a lot more exploring, and just have fun during the time I have left. I have spent most of my days this quarter hangin out with my friends and my roommates. Since Sai is finally back, I've loved having late night runs to I am Yogost, and cultivating my love for yogurt. (seriously I love yogurt). I've also been learning to set proper boundaries and protect my own peace. While there will always be some challenges to face, I've realized that the determining factor in whether that problem is solved is my attitude. If I build my life around the joy that I find, then I will be happy regardless of where I am. I'm writing this paragraph after doing a final presentation, writing a final exam, helping proctor an exam for INFO 200, and having music class. Tomorrow will be my last day of classes, and I have to say, reaching the end feels surreal. Looking back at my life over the past four years, I feel.. different (and also maybe taller? jk i'm still short)
In reality, I feel older. It might be because I just turned 22, or because of all of the things I have faced over the past few years, or a combination of both of those things. Regardless, I can honestly say that I am not the same person I was 4 years ago. I don't know where the rest of my life will take me, but I can't wait to see it happen.

gallery.gallery_alt: Rice cakes with broccoli tofu and basil
gallery.gallery_reflection: If there's one thing I love more than anything else, it's food. I created a food instagram account this year to document my Journey with food!

gallery.gallery_alt: Baloo and Mango in Discovery Park
gallery.gallery_reflection: This time of year was a lot of firsts for me! I drove to Discovery park with Nitya and Sai (and 2 dogs) across the bridge. While I have been driving for a while, this was the first time I have driven across the bridge. To say it was an eventful day would be understating it. We drove through rain, then hail, a Montlake closure, and missed our exit 3 times on i5. But now that I've done it once, I am so much more confident in my driving.

gallery.gallery_alt: All of the WINFO officers at the hackathon
gallery.gallery_reflection: With my last quarter also comes my last hackathon. I was much more involved this year as president and I am so happy with the way the hackathon came together! I cannot be more proud to have worked with the officers who made this event possible.

Title: SPRING QUARTER 2024
reflection: While I won't be in school this quarter, more of my adventures will be coming soon!
